thread.title: Dr APJ Abdul Kalam served as inspiration for millions of Indians: Obama
thread.title_full: Dr APJ Abdul Kalam served as inspiration for millions of Indians: Obama | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Dr APJ Abdul Kalam served as inspiration for millions of Indians: Obama
text:
Other Articles Bobby Jindal ranked 13th in Republican presidential race Yakub Memon execution: Security of SC judges who dismissed plea raised HRW asks India to abolish death penalty after Yakub Memon's hanging US President Barack Obama today extended his condolences on the death of former president APJ Abdul Kalam, saying he was an inspiration to millions who worked to deepen space cooperation between the two countries.
“On behalf of the American people, I wish to extend my deepest condolences to the people of India on the passing of former Indian President Dr APJ Abdul Kalam,” Obama said in a statement.
“A scientist and statesman, Dr APJ Abdul Kalam rose from humble beginnings to become one of India’s most accomplished leaders, earning esteem at home and abroad,” said Obama, who is visiting Africa.
An advocate for stronger US-India relations, APJ Abdul Kalam worked to deepen our space cooperation, forging links with NASA during a 1962 visit to the United States, he said.
“His tenure as India’s 11th president witnessed unprecedented growth in US-India ties.
“Suitably named ‘the People’s President,’ Dr APJ Abdul Kalam’s humility and dedication to public service served as an inspiration to millions of Indians and admirers around the world,” Obama said.
 29, 2015 10:08 am
